review_title: Major overhaul needed, new president provides some hope for needed change
pros: Proximity within the city of Houston; new president with active vision to "work collectively to achieve unprecedented success at an accelerated pace"; limited micro-management from administration
cons: Low pay, with expectations to give generously to the university; heavy workload; lack of student accountability from the university; disorganization and poor communication across the campus; consistent last-minute changes with expectation for faculty to react on a dime; confusion of students; apathy from veteran faculty and staff

review_title: TSU is a terrible place to work.,

review_title: Experience has been stressful, campus operations are unorganized and disheveled.
job_title: Student Services Tutor in Houston, TX
pros: Hours can be flexible during fall and spring semesters, pay is consistent regardless of student traffic, and other work can be done during work hours if you aren't currently giving tutorial services.
cons: Upper management is lacking in proper communication skills and operations, experience working there has been stressful and almost unfulfilling due to poor management operations.  There is no introductory training or seminars, everything is figured out on your own. Management does not take responsibility for they're own discrepancies, and use disparaging tactics to avoid employee concerns.

review_title: TSU is good place to Work.
job_title: Assistant Baseball Coach in Houston, TX
pros: Good place to work, especially in Athletics. AD is forward thinker and a lot of good things going on for the better of University, Students and employees.
cons: Was a non revenue sports coach so we kinda received the short end of the stick. Facilities were a major sore sport and hurt us in recruiting.

review_title: My experience at Texas Southern University has been satisfactory.
pros: I have an AWSOME supervisor.  She is the ONLY reason why I have stayed working at this institution as long as I have.
cons: There are NO opportunities for Administrative Assistants to be promoted.  So for all intents and purposes the position is a "dead end."

pros: Working for TSU feels like working for a big family! This is an atmosphere in which you know you are part of something special and life-changing. TSU is a special place with an amazing history. Employment here is a privilege, whether you are just starting out on your career path or joining as  a high-ranking administrator.
cons: In some areas, higher wages would be nice as well as updates to some of the technology. BUT, the pros still outweigh the cons :)

pros: There are no good reasons to work here
cons:
The lowest graduation rate in Texas, the lowest graduation rate among all the HBCU's. Preisdent Rudley told us these facts at November 2011 faculty meeting. But no plans to improve the culture and promote honest good people. Everything is based on nepotism and favoritism like when Slade was President. Nothing has changed. Very depressing place to work. If I could leave I would but I am stuck. 
Additionally, a faculty and administration that are at odds with each other over the direction of the university.

pros:
- The atmosphere is very laid back, but still maintained standards such as dress code, etc.
- Its a vast introduction to technology topics.
- Expert personnel is always willing to help you figure out problems.
cons:
- Pay is relatively on the low side.
- Good luck getting benefits.

pros: State insurance and benefits, sick leave and vacation.
cons: Administrators and faculty don’t communicate effectively. In some instances, it’s pass the buck University because administrators and faculty would rather pass the workload to the staff instead of doing it themselves. Politics is a common scheme. The hard workers are overlooked and friends are promoted. Even with new leadership, things are no better. There is no room for upward mobility and career advancement here unless you are buddies with someone in power. It’s unfortunate because the university offers great educational opportunities.

review_title: Depending on the department, a lot of running around could be involved.
pros: A lot of flexibility in creating work hours.
cons: Some unprofessional departments (especially for student workers) where payroll paperwork gets lost & hours miscalculated.

pros: University is becoming more academic than a party school
cons: Lost interest of students, bad relations between student and faculty and faculty and university administration.
